The problems encountered thus far can readily be
solved. Most of them are of a minor mechanical nature. We,
of network headquarters, are completely sold on the potential
of this operation. It has been necessary on occasion to
apologize for our shortcomings and our errors. But, we are
proud, indeed, to be a part of such a challenging enterprise.
The administration of the Division of Communications of the
University of Illinois has accepted its custodianship of the
network seriously. The whole-hearted support of this institution
can be assured.
With the arrival of substantial financial aid, the future
of the network is inspiring. It is impossible to see anything but
significant achievement as the result.
The network headquarters, as now constituted, would like
to go on record as thanking everyone concerned for the excellent
cooperation, patience, and support that have been accorded our,
as yet, feeble efforts. To all, our sincerest thanks.
